task.title: Configuring the Service Integration Bus
task.shortdesc: Configure the Service Integration Bus (SIB). A SIB supports applications with message-based and service-oriented architectures.

step.cmd: Browse to Service integration Buses .
Select New and set the following field Name: CuramBus
Leave all other fields as default and select Next.
Entering the Configure bus security wizard, Step 1.1, select Next

ol.li: In Step 1.2 of the Configure bus security wizard, take the default setting and select Next.
In Step 1.3 of the Configure bus security wizard, take the default setting, and select Next.
In Step 1.4 of the Configure bus security wizard, review your settings and select Next.

step.cmd: In Step 2 select Finish to apply the changes.
Select the CuramBus now displayed on the list of Buses.
Select Bus members in the Topology list.
Select Add to open the Add a New Bus Member wizard.
Select the server to add to the Bus and select Next.
Select Data store and select Next.
Select the option to use existing data source and set the options as follows:

ul.li: Schema name = username, where username is the database user name.
Leave all other options as the default and select Next.

step.cmd: Accept the default tuning parameters and select Next.
Select Finish to complete and exit the wizard.
Browse to Service integration Buses .
Select the CuramBus now displayed on the list of Buses.
Select Security in the AdditionaThis will open the configuration screen.l Properties section.
Select Users and groups in the bus connector role in the Authorization Policy section.
Select New to open the SIB Security Resource Wizard.
Select The built in special groups, and select Next.
Select the Server and AllAuthenticated check boxes and select Next.
Select Finish to complete and exit the wizard.
